etymologies: early 19th century. From quassia or its etymon scientific Latin Quassia + -in

definitions: A bitter compound isolated from the wood of Quassia amara and Picrasma excelsa, with insecticidal, antipyretic, and other medicinal properties.

notes.text: Quassin is a tetracyclic terpenoid. Formula: C₂₂H₂₈O₆.
